alert.note: Alert for Henry (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:19PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ROCK ISLAND...NORTHWESTERN MERCER...NORTHEASTERN HENRY...NORTHWESTERN DES MOINES...LOUISA AND MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 219 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Yarmouth, or 10 miles southwest of Wapello, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Amber, Cairo and Elrick Junction around 225 PM CDT. Wapello, Toolesboro and Snively Access Campground around 230 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Grandview, Flaming Prairie Park, Sand Springs, Fruitland, Eliza, Letts, Muscatine Municipal Airport, Ardon, Muscatine, Fairport, Illinois City, Fairport Recreation Area, New Era, Wildcat Den State Park and Shady Creek Campground. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Iowa. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
